info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 14 at 5:31PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Pecos, eastern Reeves and central Ward Counties through 615 PM CDT... At 530 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Pyote, or 13 miles south of Wink, moving southeast at 5 mph, and another strong thunderstorm south of Pyote moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Monahans, Thorntonville, Pyote, Wickett and Roy Hurd Memorial Airport. This includes Interstate 20 between mile markers 56 and 79. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
